item.title: april violet add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: april violet add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "Listen,” F. Jasmine said. “What I’ve been trying to say is this. Doesn’t it strike you as strange that I am I, and you are you? I am F. Jasmine Addams. And you are Berenice Sadie Brown. And we can look at each other, and touch each other, and stay together year in and year out in the same room. Yet always I am I, and you are you. And I can’t ever be anything else but me, and you can ever be anything else but you. Have you ever thought of that? And does it seem to you strange? " -- Carson McCullers

item.title: april violet add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "No live organism can continue for long to exist sanely under conditions of absolute reality." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: april violet add a quote by Antonin Artaud
item.description: "How hard is it, when everything encourages us to sleep, though we may look about us with conscious, clinging eyes, to wake and yet look about us as in a dream, with eyes that no longer know their function and whose gaze is turned inward." -- Antonin Artaud

item.title: april violet add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "Quentin Crisp (to handsome young man on the street): "What's the matter, sexy? Don't you like dehydrated fruit?" -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: april violet add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "I am unable to believe in a God susceptible to prayer. I simply haven't the nerve to imagine a being, a force, a cause which keeps the planets revolving in their orbits, and then suddenly stops in order to give me a bicycle with three speeds." -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: april violet add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "That’s what I liked about those nuns. You could tell, for one thing, that they never went anywhere swanky for lunch. It mad me so damn sad when I thought about it, their never going anywhere swanky for lunch or anything. I knew it wasn’t too important, but it made me sad anyway." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: april violet add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "In an expanding universe, time is on the side of the outcast. Those who once inhabited the suburbs of human contempt find that without changing their address they eventually live in the metropolis." -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: april violet add a quote by Janet Frame
item.description: "Everything is always a story, but the loveliest ones are those that get written and are not torn up and are taken to a friend as payment for listening, for putting a wise keyhole to the ear of my mind" -- Janet Frame

item.title: april violet add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description:
"...I doubt very seriously whether anyone will hire me.'
What do you mean, babe? You a fine boy with a good education.'
Employers sense in me a denial of their values.' He rolled over onto his back. 'They fear me. I suspect that they can see that I am forced to function in a century I loathe. This was true even when I worked for the New Orleans Public Library." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: april violet add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "Then she broke down and cried onto the flowery wrapping paper. Melanie put her arms around the poor, thin body. What is Aunt Margaret made of? Birdbones and tissue paper. spun glass and straw." -- Angela Carter

item.title: april violet add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "I could live there all alone, she thought, slowing the car to look down the winding garden path to the small blue front door with, perfectly, a white cat on the step. No one would ever find me there, either, behind all those roses, and just to make sure I would plant oleanders by the road. I will light a fire in the cool evenings and toast apples at my own hearth. I will raise white cats and sew white curtains for the windows and sometimes come out of my door to go to the store to buy cinnamon and tea and thread. People will come to me to have their fortunes told, and I will brew love potions for sad maidens; I will have a robin..." -- Shirley Jackson
